Articles.Content:
--Extra Tubes--

...snip...

Nice work. Grabbing those!

For any interested, there are some other bays/covers like this in FASA (MOL bays), but they don't play nice with FAR. If you don't have FAR, then it doesn't matter!

@a__gun: Thanks for the new sizes! Now I can do something like this!

I'd have to find a way to lower the light intensity though.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

@a__gun: Thanks for the new sizes! Now I can do something like this!

I'd have to find a way to lower the light intensity though.

http://imgur.com/a/X4ekp

That's awesome I can do KAS container resizes if that would be useful...

I have made a set of cfgs for extra tubes to expand this fantastic mod. As well as the original two varieties, there is now a 3.75m tube and taller variants of all three sizes (Making 6 different types in total!). They have all had their mass, cost and position in the tech-tree balanced.

Nice resize! I will be including some more cargo bays similar to compartment tubes with FLEXracks.

Nice resize! I will be including some more cargo bays similar to compartment tubes with FLEXracks.

Hey I had good resources to start from

Really its just intended to tide me over until FLEXracks gets a release

I just want to say this is one of my favorite mods. It really cleans up my craft so well!

Does this or will this mod have a 3.75m service compartment in the future?

I just want to say this is one of my favorite mods. It really cleans up my craft so well!

Does this or will this mod have a 3.75m service compartment in the future?

I made a full set of tubes (including 3.75m) you can get here (still needs the original mod to work)
Ooh awesome, this mod is on the must have list and your tweaks a__gun are exactly what I was hoping to have. Grats, job well done!! :-)

I made a full set of tubes (including 3.75m) you can get here (still needs the original mod to work)

Awesome! Was just about to do this to get a 3.75m tube, thank you for taking the time!
Thankyou for this and thanks @a__gun for the extension.
I just noticed the word pun "6S" Success". I've had this mod for 2 months.
Does FAR exclude the drag of everything inside the compartment? (basically, takes it as a fairing)
What a great idea! I used the telescoping hydraulics to deploy my antenna and sensor packages out the door, looks much better than having them sticking on the side.

Does FAR exclude the drag of everything inside the compartment? (basically, takes it as a fairing)

Yep! It shields the things inside it
It looks like Nothke worked on something similar in 3.75m last year. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/29031-0-23-Hollow-Structure-Hulls?p=358339&viewfull=1#post358339
Helps hide RTGs or monopropellant tanks I don't want sticking out on my ship. Awesome!

Hi, first of all great mod, really like the idea. Especially because i just started a fresh savegame for the 'realistic career mode'

I play with FAR and just yesterday I to build the first rocket using the 1m Service compartment. But all the parts placed inside weren't shielded. After a bit of research in Farrams thread and this one if encountered shielding works for the larg 2m compartment but not for the small one. Is it FAR or the Part?

keep the great work up!

Edit: Got it working again so never mind After a bit of messing around with the cfg-Files (changing nodes definitions, using same modelfile 'SerCom2mt3' for both parts) and reeinstalling a fresh copy of FAR and 6s SerCom, I gave up. Then I installed the fairings from the KW Rocketry and now both service compartments work as expected.

Edited March 18, 2014 by Georg Kerbfeldt

I made a full set of tubes (including 3.75m) you can get here (still needs the original mod to work)

Your extra tubes seem to shrink slightly on a reload of a vessel. Don't think the originals have that problem.

Anyone else have this?

After a bit of research in Farrams thread and this one if encountered shielding works for the larg 2m compartment but not for the small one.

It should work in the experimental FAR. The previous version had an issue with cargo bay parts that were too small.

Your extra tubes seem to shrink slightly on a reload of a vessel. Don't think the originals have that problem.

Anyone else have this?

Do you mean they get squashed or literally become smaller in every direction? I have no idea why that would be the case.

I think I am seeing problems when I combine. This mod with the RCS build aid. If I have a craft with a 6s, then RCS seems to have trouble displaying the CoM (indeed as does the game via the editor CoM button.)

Has anyone else seen this problem?

Do you mean they get squashed or literally become smaller in every direction? I have no idea why that would be the case.

iirc it's a bug with root parts using model nodes. Solution - don't use the part as root.
Looks great, these will make it easier for my ships that I want to be "clean" on the exterior to have plenty of extra stuff in them.
I love these things. My Rockets are so much better looking and better engineered with the help of your tubes.

iirc it's a bug with root parts using model nodes. Solution - don't use the part as root.

Ahh that makes sense then, thanks
